official-title.#text: To properly define and distinguish between decorative hearth products and vented hearth heaters.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by inserting at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 321 of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act

header.#text: Vented hearth heaters and decorative hearth products

quote.#tail: means a vented gas fireplace, vented fireplace insert, or vented stove—

text.#text: for which any AFUE representation, or representation with respect to P.4 efficiencies required for products sold in Canada, is made in any manufacturer advertising or literature;
that is certified to the ANSI Z21.88 standard or identified in any manufacturer literature or advertising as a
that is equipped by the manufacturer with a thermostatic control.

continuation-text.#text: Decorative hearth products shall not be considered direct heating equipment for purposes of this part. A vented gas fireplace, vented fireplace insert, vented stove, or vented gas log set that is not a decorative hearth product shall be considered direct heating equipment for purposes of this part.

quote.#tail: means a vented gas fireplace, vented fireplace insert, vented stove, or vented gas log set that—

text.#text: is not certified to the ANSI Z21.88 standard and, in the case of a vented gas fireplace, vented fireplace insert, or vented stove, is certified to the ANSI Z21.50 standard;
is sold without a thermostat and with a warranty provision expressly voiding all manufacturer warranties in the event the product is used with a thermostat; and
contains no energy efficiency representations other than P.4 efficiencies required for products sold in Canada.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3761 IH: To properly define and distinguish between decorative hearth products and vented hearth heaters.
